channel.title: LinSpire AKA Lindows
channel.description:
This OS is so brilliant!
It's only about $50 at CompUSA. It's exactly like Windows, can execute 90% of all .exe files and use any windows program, and has Linux's security. Never again worry about security, viruses, spyware, adware, any kind of other random shit that the whore Windows will get fucked with.
It's pretty much a Windows Emulator with very very good security and awesome programs builtin. Very good for people who like windows and are comfortable with windows, but just don't want to get hacked.
[url=http://images.linspire.com/linspire5.0intro4-8-6.swf]Here is the Flash Intro to get you into it.[/url]
~Ron ;)
Editted thanks to revan.

item.title: LinSpire AKA Lindows
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Freddy1990:

Isn't linux supposed to be free?

Yeah... That's the ONLY thing I don't like about LinSpire.

So many Linux OS's started charging which is bullshit, since most of them didn't even do the work! RedHat started charging something like $175 for Linux. LinSpire is $50, and I'm sure there are at least 20 more different pay-for OS's.

Xerxes:

I am not. It just dosen't sound so good.

So explain yourself. Don't just give an opinion without something to stand on man. It's like me asking someone "Hey what's up" and they act like a doosh bag and say "nm" and end the conversation. What doesn't sound good about it Xerxes? Please explain yourself.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: LinSpire AKA Lindows
item.dc:creator: @Revan Revan
item.description:
@Revan wrote:

Ron:

I've seen that book before. Too many commands!!! ARRGHH lol.

Yeah that book sucks as it overcomlicates things (which is what its NOT supposed to do) best way to learn to use *nix is get a crappy old 486 and install a distro like Debian and play with it. You may screw alot of it up, but eh, thats why its called "learning".

item.title: LinSpire AKA Lindows
item.dc:creator: @Revan Revan
item.description:
@Revan wrote:

Ron:

This OS is so brilliant!

It's only about $50 at CompUSA. It's exactly like Windows, can execute all .exe files and use any windows program, and has Linux's security. Never again worry about security, viruses, spyware, adware, any kind of other random shit that the whore Windows will get fucked with.

It's pretty much a Windows Emulator with very very good security and awesome programs builtin. Very good for people who like windows and are comfortable with windows, but just don't want to get hacked.

Here is the Flash Intro to get you into it.

~Ron

Actually it CANT execute all .exe files. Most can be though, as not all Windows programs are *nix compatable, even with Cedega/WINE. As far as it being a good *nix distro, its great for beginners, but you really wont learn much about *nix as this is mostly "Linux for Dummies"

Read full topic
